meta.title: Home - Seymour Public School District

li.a: David A. Brumer Excellence in Education Award
Vincentena Kobasa Excellence in Teaching Award
John J. Gallagher Memorial Athletic Award
Thomas J. Petruny Memorial Education and Environment Award
USDA Food & Nutrition Service: Team Nutrition

div.p: We hope that you all enjoyed your extended summer break this year and got to spend time doing the things that make you happy and refreshed. Hopefully, the summer months provided you and your family time to reconnect and relax.

p.span: As a result of the recent extreme heat as well as with the winter season approaching, I feel like now is a good time to share with you how some of these decisions are made. I first want to reiterate that your children’s safety is always our number one priority.

div.p: Come meet Mr. Wilson and his Team!

article.a: Continue Reading about Meet & Greet **Date Changed**

div.p: It is now time for your nominations for Seymour’s Teacher of the Year 2018-19. Any staff member, parent, or student who feels that he/she would like to recognize an outstanding teacher, can do so now. Nominees should be teachers with at least five full years of experience in Seymour and must be teaching now at least 50% of the time. Former Seymour Teachers of the Year are not eligible. (Names of those so honored are attached to this letter).

article.a: Continue Reading about Teacher of The Year Nominations

div.a: Spring Trivia Night Sponsored by HS HOPE Club

article.a: Event Details about Spring Trivia Night Sponsored by HS HOPE Club

div.p: Seymour Public Schools is committed to a policy of equal opportunity/affirmative action for all qualified persons and does not discriminate in any employment practice, education program, or educational activity on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, religion or any other basis prohibited by Connecticut state and/or federal nondiscrimination laws. Inquiries regarding the nondiscrimination policies should be directed to the Title IX Coordinator, Vonda Tencza, Associate Superintendent, 203-888-4564.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

p.span: April 9, 2020
Hello Seymour Public School Community,

We hope that this message finds you all healthy and safe. As I have shared throughout my numerous communications, Seymour is a great community and together we will get through this. In the words of Anita Krizzan, “Life will get warmer”.

We are about to enter into our much needed Spring Break starting on April 10, 2020 and going through April 19, 2020. We are hopeful that even though you may not be able to do the traditional things that you would normally do during a Spring Break, you do get time to relax and reconnect as a family.

While distance learning will and can never replace the classroom experience, these last three weeks of distance learning have been tremendous in terms of our teachers providing the best possible learning experience possible for our wonderful students. My team is definitely impressed and amazed by all of the effective and creative instruction that has taken place these past three weeks. We want to once again give a HUGE ROUND OF APPLAUSE to the following:
Our students for continuing to work hard each and every day in their virtual classrooms.
Our teachers for all of their hard work in their creation and implementation of fabulous lessons.
Our administrators for all of the support they have given to teachers, students, and parents this week.

Our parents for remaining positive and patient and for sharing your positive words of encouragement with members of our team. As a parent myself, I know how difficult it is for you to be there to support your children with their work, while still doing the work that you need to do for your job. It is not easy, but I know that you are there for your children, and for that, I wanted to say thank you.

Our custodians for their tireless effort in keeping our buildings clean and sanitized and for continuing to go in each and every day to ensure that our buildings are ready for when our students return.
Our cafeteria staff for their tireless work to provide our families with meals during the past three weeks.
Our IT staff who have been working extremely hard to ensure that all of our technology needs for our entire staff as well as our parents are being met.
Our secretaries who have been continuing their hard work to ensure that the needs of the building are being met throughout this time and preparing for when we return.
Our nurses for being there to support our students and parents virtually with any questions that they may have.
Our paraprofessionals who have been assisting both teachers and students with distance learning.
Our Central Office Team who are continually working with all staff to ensure that things are going as smoothly as possible as well as preparing for our return to school.

I hope that your children are enjoying being read to each night. We all know how important reading is and this is just one small way for us to help promote reading to our children. Getting to visit virtual classrooms has been the highlight of my administrator’s day because it is there that they get to interact with the students whom we miss so much. Getting to virtually meet with our staff has been the highlight of our days because it is there that we get to hear about all of the great ideas that our teachers and administrators are sharing with one another to enhance distance learning. Their hard work and dedication to our students is amazing. Our teachers are very creative and care deeply about student learning and engagement. They are continuously working hard to create and implement distance-learning lessons that continue to motivate all of our students to learn and achieve.

We recently shared our Accountability Index score from the State of Connecticut at the virtual April Board of Education meeting, which showed areas of growth in each of our four wonderful schools from last year to this year. This growth is a tremendous accomplishment and illustrates the continued focus and dedication of our students, teachers, and administrators. Their hard work is applauded and I am confident that we will continue to experience growth. Please make sure to view your child’s third quarter grades via your computer PowerSchool portal.

This afternoon, I had a conference call with the Governor and the Commissioner of Education where they addressed many public issues, including a potential school return date. As of this evening, schools will remain closed up until May 20, 2020. While this can change, this is the most up to date information that we have at this time. We will continue to use our distance-learning platform up until we are physically able to return to school. Our last day of school will still be June 12, 2020 and high school graduation will be held that evening.
Lunch For All

There will be no lunch served during Spring Break as our cafeteria staff will also be taking a much-needed break next week. However, since we will be out longer than April 20, 2020, we will continue to provide lunch 3 days a week for pick up at Seymour Middle School. Pick up times are between 11:00am and 1:00pm on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday of each week starting again on Tuesday April 21, 2020 up until our potential date of return, which is May 20, 2020.

We want to once again reiterate that Seymour Public Schools recognizes this is a concerning time for all and that no digital plan will ever replace your child’s teacher and we want to thank you for your continued patience and partnership! As always, all staff are here to help in any way needed to ensure an equitable learning experience for students. Please note that during this time of working remotely, our staff will be expected to be actively engaged in work during the hours of 8:00am -2:00pm and to be available for calls, video conferencing if the teacher chooses, email and messaging exchanges, and the like. All staff will be available by email or other form of acceptable electronic communication to support students who are working on these learning assignments, assist families, or reply to questions or requests.
Please continue to look on the following mediums for any communications from our schools:
• Seymour Schools Facebook
• Seymour Schools website
Here are the IF THEN scenarios that we have in place for our end of year ceremonies and events:
we return to school on or before May 20, 2020:
we will continue with Prom on a later date in May 2020 or early in June 2020 as well as with High School Graduation on June 12, 2020.
we will continue with Middle School Promotion Ceremony on the morning of June 12, 2020.
we will continue with Bungay and CLS Moving Up Ceremonies in both K and Grade 5 as scheduled.
Kindergarten registration will be held between May 20, 2020 and June 12, 2020 with further details being provided by our Student Registration Specialist, Cathy Guerra.
we do not return to school for the remainder of the 2019 – 2020 school year:

we will hold High School Graduation on June 26, 2020 at 6:00pm provided the STAY HOME STAY SAFE ORDER has been lifted prior to this date and the team working on Prom will work hard to find another date later in June of 2020 but there are no guarantees that this will happen. A communication from SHS will come out regarding the possibility of this.
we will set up a schedule where students and staff will be able to come in to collect their belongings for their summer vacation.
Moving Up and Promotion Ceremonies in grades K, 5, and 8 will be cancelled.
Kindergarten registration will take place using a digital platform on which you will receive further details from our Student Registration Specialist, Cathy Guerra, the week of May 4, 2020.
every effort will be made to hold Kindergarten, grade 6, and grade 9 orientation in August of 2020.
the STAY HOME AND STAY SAFE ORDER is still on until the end of June 2020:
we will hold High School Graduation on July 10, 2020 at 6:00pm provided the STAY HOME STAY SAFE ORDER has been lifted prior to this date.
EXTENDED SCHOOL YEAR, ELL, as well as a Credit Recovery Program will begin on July 6, 2020 provided the STAY HOME STAY SAFE ORDER has been lifted prior to this date.

Please make every effort to keep your families safe and healthy. I hope that you have a wonderful relaxing and safe Spring Break; we look forward to seeing everyone back in their digital classrooms on Monday April 20, 2020.
Our community will continue to get through this as a team!
With great pride,
Michael Wilson, Superintendent
Go Wildcats!
